nodes.label: Algorithmic Strategies
nodes.title: Algorithmic Strategies: Algorithmic Strategies covers various approaches and techniques used to design and analyze algorithms

nodes.label: Parallel
nodes.title: Parallel : Algorithms designed to execute multiple computational tasks simultaneously, exploiting parallel processing capabilities for improved efficiency.

nodes.label: Consensus algorithms
nodes.title: Consensus algorithms : Algorithms used in distributed computing to achieve agreement among a group of participants despite some of them possibly failing or behaving maliciously.

nodes.label: Fundamental Data Structures and Algorithms
nodes.title: Fundamental Data Structures and Algorithms: including arrays, linked lists, trees, sorting and searching algorithms

nodes.label: Consensus Algorithms
nodes.title: Consensus Algorithms: e.g. Blockchain; Protocols enabling distributed systems to agree on a single data value

nodes.label: Parallel and distributed system introduction
nodes.title: Parallel and distributed system introduction: An overview of computing systems that involve multiple processors or computers working together to solve a problem.

nodes.label: Parallel_Architecture
nodes.title: Parallel_Architecture: The design and organization of hardware systems that support parallel processing, involving multiple processors or processing units.

nodes.label: Parallelism options
nodes.title: Parallelism options: options include CPU level, e.g., multi core, many core, machine level, e.g., shared memory, distributed memory.

nodes.label: Parallel_Application
nodes.title: Parallel_Application: Software or programs designed to execute tasks concurrently on multiple processors or cores

nodes.label: Multi_threading
nodes.title: Multi_threading: A programming model that allows multiple threads of execution to run concurrently within the same process, enabling parallelism and efficient resource utilization.

nodes.label: Parallelism options
nodes.title: Parallelism options: Various methods and techniques for introducing parallelism in computing systems

nodes.label: DApp
nodes.title: DApp: Decentralized Application, a software application that operates on a decentralized network, typically built on blockchain technology and utilizing smart contracts.

nodes.label: Blockchain
nodes.title: Blockchain: A distributed ledger technology that records transactions across multiple computers in a secure and immutable manner, providing transparency and integrity.

nodes.label: Consensus
nodes.title: Consensus: The process by which a distributed network agrees on the validity of transactions and maintains a consistent state, often achieved through various consensus mechanisms.
